text: Appearance: dark brown, nice lacing head. Aroma: wood, caramel, coffee. Taste: medium sweat, medium bitter. Burning alcohol sensation, long harsh bitter finish. Didnt like it...

At a tasting, thanks, small stable creamy head, cloudy dark red color, aroma of caramel, nut and rum with a bready backbone, caramel dark bread, butterscotch, rum flavor, smooth, medium bodied. Enjoyable and true to the style but not overly exciting.
Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Stas, Amber with a beige head. Aroma and taste of malt, toffee, prunes, brown sugar and caramel. Medium-full bodied. Nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles place. Thanks Stas, Nice hazy reddish amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, light oxidation, some fruits. Sweet flavor with malt, caramel, fruits. Medium-bodied, quite rounded. Pretty basic, but quite classic and nice.
At Drors place, pours brown with a beige head, aroma of malt, caramel, flavor is slightly bitter with malt, caramel, medium bodied
Bottle (from beer navigator). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, malty, , some sugar. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, hops, fruits. Finish is dry-malty bitter. Overall very good.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 330ml bottle, shared by Mart, thanks! Clear red beer, small beige head. Nose is malty, caramel, sweetness, oaky vanilla. Flavor is malty malt, caramel, slight berry sourness, toasty acidity. Finish is malty and mildly hoppy. Pretty nice.

Robijnrood tegen bruin, crèmekleurige foamy  schuimkraag, troebel, aardig wat koolzuur zichtbaar. 
Aroma: Karamel zoete donkere mouten, iets chocolade, licht koffie, geroosterde hint en fruitig.
Smaak: Lichte metaal toets, donkere mout, chocolade en iets koffie, een fruitige zoet van rozijnen en donker fruit. Redelijke volle hopbitter die fruirig is en met kruidigheid. 
De 9% merk je totaal niet moet ik zeggen.... licht wat warmte.
Aktief koolzuur, medium body, aktief en prikkelig mondgevoel, afdronk is lekker bitter met koffie en iets droog. Lange nasmaak.
Prima Ijsbock.
Beslist straffe eisbock. Zwaar, redelijk zoet, hoog in alcohol. Geen ruzie mee maken.
rokerige hout geur,mout donker fruit zacht bitter naar prikkelend in de afdronk.
Bottle - pours brown white head - nose/taste of caramel, light bready malt and some fruits - medium body

Bottle from 2009 at Cellar cleanup tasting at Deansos. Courtesy of kermis. Sweet caramel malts, leathery bitterness, light oak, chestnut, vanilla, all very smoothened out. Over medium body, soft feel and bittersweet nutty dry finish.
Bottle shared. Dark ruby with visible sedimentation and a thin tan head. Notes of chocolate, dried fruit, figs, sherry. Medium bodied, low carbonation and a sticky sweet finish.

Barwa ciemno-miedziana, piana ładna, biała i trwała.
Aromat średnio-intensywny zdominowany suszonymi owocami w postaci rodzynek i wiśni, w tle nuty karmelowe
W smaku przypalony karmel i syrop. Owoce w drugim planie, pojawi się ordynarna żelazistość - jakby w szkle było kilka gwoździ. Piwo jest słodkie, alkohol ukryty.
At Kerstbierfestival 2015. Pours clear, dark amberbrown. Small white head. Smell is bit sweet, rather intense. Taste is nice, bitterness, mild dryness. OK.

Pours dark brown with a stable, lasting beige head. Aroma of roast malts and yeast. Some dark fruits, mild spices... Bit too mild on the nose in general. Misses outspokenness... Tastewise definitely more interesting if you ask me. Very moderate and well-balanced in terms of sweetness and bitterness. Nice sweetish beginning with some nutty caramel notes. Tones of chocolate, liquorice, spices, dark fruits throughout the sip and some good mild roastiness in the end. Some nice burned notes as well. Bit of a warming alcohol, but it is quite well hidden in general. Well-balanced and autumny brew. Definitely tasty Eisbock indeed. Medium bodied, thickish and sticky in texture and moderately carbonated. Great brew. Could have been more pronounced in general. But all-in-all a more than decent brew.

Donkerbruin, kraag blijft lang als een laagje op het bier liggen.
Ruikt heel moutig, beetje peper, drop. Smaakt droppig, mout, peper, stroop.
Helaas wat waterig en een wat rare bij- en nasmaak.

Aroma:

Roasted malts, caramel, bread, slight oil or something like that.

Appearance:

Dark ruby/brown beer with a medium light brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts sweet with malts and caramel, then slowly fades to bread.

Bier met een zalige geschiedenis. IJsbok is een levend, niet gepasteuriseerd, bovengistend bier. Inspiratiebron voor dit in Europa unieke bier is het Nova Zembla reisverslag Om de Noord van Gerrit de Veer uit 1597. Het verslag beschrijft hoe de scheepsbemanning tot hun verbazing ontdekte dat diep in een bevroren bierfust een vloeistof was achtergebleven, die uitstekend smaakte en waarbij alle kracht van het bier in dat kleine beetje nog vloeibare bier zat

On tap at PINT Bokbierfestival 2015. Clear, brownish amber with a creamy, tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, prunes and brown sugar. Sweetish-malty taste of raisins, prunes and brown sugar. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice!

Bottle at home. It pours a dark strawberry red with a chestnut hue. Lightly tanned thick and moussy, frothy head. Very fine soft carbonation visible.
Aroma is of sweet malts, soft hops, hay, grass, white pepper hint, fruity back notes like pear, hints also of nut and yeast, surprisingly mingled with an umami smell like chickenstock.
Taste has fruity notes like pear, kiwi and a banana hint, sweet malts, a gin-like acohol taste caramel, an umami silt aftertaste with hints of pepper and hopbitterness. A soft, dry powdery mouthfeel, with in that umami silt edge a miniscule metal edge with citrus acidity. Nice soft carbonation with a warming alcohol glow, which is well masqued, a lot better then in their Koning Honing. This ones got a good balance for such a more or less extreme genre if beer! Its beautifully made. I like it very much...

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2015 Fles gekocht bij biernavigatie, uitgeschonken in Sint Crispijn bierglas. Licht troebel donkerbruin bier met een rode gloed. Beige schuimkraag, die zich na enige tijd terugtrekt. Volle en rijke aromas kenmerken dit IJsbok bier van SNAB. Geroosterde mout, karamel, chocolade, gedroogd fruit: rozijnen, vijgen en dadels, ook iets van koffie en tabak. Ook het smaakpallet is mooi complex, licht zoet en zacht bitter en mooi gebalanceerd. Geroosterde mout, chocolade, drop, kruidige en lichte aardachtige tonen. Echt een lekker bier deze ijsbok, complex, vol en rijk bier met een smaakpallet wat enigszins lijkt op Kasteel Cuvee du Chateau, de alcohol is goed verborgen. De afdronk is zacht bitter met een olieachtig mondgevoel. Het beste bier van SNAB tot nu toe voor mij, maakt nieuwsgierig naar de IJsbok hout.

Un eisbock sur 4 malts et du Hallertau Hersbrucker, pour un niveau abv de 9 % et ebu de 32.
Couleur noir aux reflets roux en transparence (100 ebc).
Bulles fines en colonne centrale vive.
Mousse brun clair à fins flocons, qui nappe constamment à 1 mm.
Arômes de prunes, figues, mûres noires, raisins secs, pointe de caramel et miel.
1ère bouche magnifique de céréales, bois, tabac, fruits mûrs.
Arrière-bouche avec un peu de café, chicorée, beaucoup de malt chocolat.
2ème au splendide équilibre malt/fruit/levure/épice.
Arrière-bouche longue, dense.
3ème à la grande texture, grandes saveurs et superbe équilibre.
Arrière-bouche pleine et complexe.
Longueur très grande, avec une infinité de nuances et de la chaleur.
Jambes fines, bien marquées.
Levure fruitée, avec un peu dépice, très belle veine, noble.
Alcool qui fait un très grand travail sur lensemble, magnifique.
Finale très grande, qui décolle vraiment.
CONCLUSION : énorme eisbock, à la saveur riche, au plaisir immense, aux envolées célestes.

Bottle at Ashs. Pours clear dark brown with a thin white head. Aromas of toffee, biscuit, oranges. Taste is sweet, caramel. More orange. Sweet finish. Not sure why they went to the trouble of freezing the water out. Why not just brew a strong beer in the first place?

Bottle thanks to Stuu666.
Appearance - deep brown or black. Nice head. 
Nose - toffee, malt and some biscuits.
Taste - more of the same. Oranges on the finish.
Palate - medium to full bodied with a tangy texture and a balanced dry finish.
Overall - a nice rich beer.
Bottle at ashs. Pours deep amber brown, nose is toffee, caramel, berry, taste is similar, sweet, sugary.

Dark brown with mocha colored lasting dense head. Very strong aroma of metal, cherry, chestnut, bock, molasses. Oily taste, starts sweet with cherry marmalade, prune. Moves towards a slightly bitter rye, molasses, dark chocolate, creamy taste. Balanced and robust taste. Aftertaste is bitter, coffee, coffee pulp. Interesting.

Fra flaske på RBHD-treff hos OG mars-15: klar brunlig med beige skum som varer. Deilig maltaroma med kardemomme, ristede nøtter og hjemmelagde sjokoladekjeks. Kombinert med en saftig bæraktig smak og en lang, bløt ettersmak. Mm, dette er kjempegodt sies det rundt bordet, og vi tømte glassene til bunns, her skulle ingenting gå til spille!
Shared bottle at RBHD gathering, March 2015. Pungent inviting malty nose. Silky smooth, full bodied beer. Pleasant malty liquorice, and bitter chocolate with a hint of cardamum in the mouth.

Shared 330 ml bottle at local tasting. Very dark brown colour, moderate beige head. Strong malty aroma, notes of molasses and oak. Very malty flavour, again notes of molasses and oak, but not too sweet for an eisbock. Also some interesting spicy notes.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours hazy deep ruby with a small creamy tanned head. Aroma of christmas cookies, cardamum, taste is moderate sweet creamy malts, lots of spices, lingering liquorice, nice.

Shared bottle at RB/HD at OGJ?s 03.03.15. Brown. Pale brown head. Wonderful aroma of sweet malt and roasted nuts. Similar taste, with a hint of cardamom, other spices and chocolate biscuits. Very fine aftertaste.
Bottle. Bittersweet beer. "Imperial bock". Notes of honey, marzipan, spices and licorice.

Bottle from Bierkonung. 
Pours hazy brown. Taste of licorice, dark chocolate and malt.
On tap at Asgard. Dark with a beige head. Aroma of sweet malts, spices, alcohol. Taste is sweet, malty, spices, warming alcohol, sweet malty aftertaste with hints of chocolate. Not bad.
* Old rating from 2010. Best before 19.08.10. Malzig-dickflüssiges, intensives Bier. Schokolade, dunkles Malz, tiefgehend.
33cl bottle @ home. Good bockbeer. Some stronger then a regular bock. Taste of chocolate, malt and caramel.

33cl flesje via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 9%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin met mooi cremelaagje

Aroma en smaak: gebrande mouten, chocolade, koffie, caramel, bitterzoet

Conclusie: tussen een bok en een stout in, zeker met het alcoholpercentage van 9%. Wel een lekker bier moet ik zeggen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown with a medium off white head that fades somewhat. Aroma has lovely hints of citrus fruits and yeast. The aroma fades quickly though. The taste is very nice. I recognize hops with a very particular taste that makes me think of Jopen beers. At first the taste remind me of citrus fruits too. Great stuff!
Haagse hopjes is smaak en aroma, suiker, chocolade-koffie en bepaalde pittigheid. Redelijk doordrinkbaar, geen uitgesproken nasmaak. Donker met redelijke kraag.

The guys of SNAB revived an old beer style and created a full bodies and very complex beer. Its definitely not a drinking beer, its a Bière de dégustation - something to enjoy slowly in front of your chimney. Untill the last sip and then fall asleep. What a wonderful thought.
Gedronken op het bokbierfestival 10-2014 met Nick Ferrara. Commentaar uit boekje: mout, caramel, bitterig.

Bottle, pours deep ruby brown with a beige head. Aroma: dark fruit, roast. Taste: chocolate, roast, raisins, prunes, brown sugar, herbs, hay. Medium sweet, medium bitter, creamy mouthfeel. Nice, somewhat stout like bock.
Stout like soya aroma. Nice little white head. Dark chocolate colour and high in carbonation. Iron like coffee chocolate malty creamy taste. Interesting wat of brewing and good result!

0,33 l bottle, bought at Grebhan´s, Bremen. Pours out in a darkest red brown. Creamy beige two fingers head. Heavy dark fruity and wood on the nose. Starts more smooth, malt, barrelwood, caramell, light sweetness, dry herb fruits. Don´t forget the alcohol! Little bit too short middle part. Could be more complex in the ending.

Tap at 37th bokbier festival. Clear deep red pour with rich frothy cream head. Aroma is really toasty, light fruitiness, light nutty aromas, really toast forward with grassy hop, nice light caramel. Taste is moderately sweet, roasty. Palate is med-full bodied with med carbonation, nice drinkability. Nice clean bok, good stuff.
Aroma of malt, dried fruits, caramel, raisins, plum, chocolate. Flavour is malty and sweet with a little booziness. Finish is bittersweet. Nice Eisbock.

Dark brown beer with a beige head.
Taste/aroma is caramel, chocolate malt, malt, roasted bitterness.
Tasty brew.

Een donkerbruin bier met een fraaie schuimkraag, licht beige van kleur. Moutige geur met tinten van chocola. De smaak is zoetig met tinten gedroogd fruit, chocola, mout en een licht bittere afdronk. Een lekkere zware bok!
Geruch malzig, rosinig, Vanille, Karamell. Beginnt malzig süß. Mitte schokoladige Züge, prickelnd. Ausklang süß, Malz, röstig, Vanille, alkoholisch. Üppiges Bier.

Classically made Eisbock produced by the Proefbrouwerij for SNAB. Yellowish beige, creamy head, bronze colour, hazy. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, dates, caramel, ginger, black pepper, bayleaf; candied fruits in the mouth, some pear, sweetish and spicy, drying from the middle onwards with a Scotch-like roasted bitterness in the end as well as a medium strong, floral hop bitterness. Very agreeable winter warmer.

33 cl bottle.
Pours dark mahogany color with a huge frothy head. Lots of sweet ripe fruits on the nose, caramel malts, earth, some molasses and some resin. Very malty and sweet fruity flavor, slightly yeasty, herbal and somewhat sugary sweet, faint rye and oat notes appear also. Slightly warming alcohol, sticky sweet palate. Decent.
5323
From notes. Nose is brown sugar, leading to treacle and smoked apple. Taste follows but the sweetness is too pronounced.

Kastanjebruin, zeer licht nevelig bier met licht beige schuimkraag. Ruikt zoet, suikers, licht houtgerookt. Verder aroma van mout, bessen. Smaak is medium zuur, medium zoet, bitterheid komt pas wat door op de nasmaak. Filmend, vrij zacht. Lekker.

Bottle 33cl. Almost black with a nice beige foamy head. Great aroma of liquorize, burned malt, caramel and a hint of banana. What a great taste... Very rich. One of my absolute favorite Dutch bok beers. Very pleasant bitter finish which is long. A must to taste for bok beer lovers

Draught at Kafé België. Hazy brown with a medium off-white head. Medium to full body with lively carbonation. Sweet with some herbal bitter tones. Licorice, vanilla, raisins, caramel, brown sugar and some chocolate. A full flavoured tasty brew.
Rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig süß, fruchtig, alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr süß, malzig fruchtig, den Alkohol merkt man deutlich.

Medium light brown head, dark brown colour, fruity strawberry like smell honey hints and soft malty notes, medium sparkling carbonation, medium coffee burned like bitter, alcohol notes, some honey and liquorise like taste

Bottle from ABC Beers, Den Haag. Poured a clear dark amber with a long-lasting frothy white head and some broken lace. The aroma is crisp dry yeast and red berry fruit. The flavour is medium bitter with a dry spice hop, malt, liqourice, slightly medicinal palate. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and a short bitter finish. Creamy slightly oily mouthfeel.

33cl bottle
Appearance: clear ruby red with a good head (which last less long as the barel stored version.)
Aroma: autumn fruits, camarelised malts , 
Taste:similar to aroma but with some cinamon and hints off coffee and liquorice., complex palate
Medium body with high carbonation.
Strong one. Quite complex but the sweets were to much out there for me. Raisin is well represented. Expected a little more roasted/bitter flavours.

Bottle @ Croydonia, sourced @ Kris Wines. Im always happy to find an eisbock in the wild. The pours amber with a small head. The nose is autumn fruits. Earthy toffee, red apple. The taste is similar. Unwashed red fruits. Red apple. Caramel. Full body, slightly slick. Not bad.
Fles33cl. Kleur rood bruin. Mooie schuimkraag. Verdwijnd snel. Geur. Koffie en kaneel. Smaak relatief bitter. Beetje zout. Koffie chovolade en kaneel

Mooi donker( cola)bier. Veel CO2 schuim kraag mooi geel kleurig. Smaak zacht zoet en kruidig(kaneel).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2014 Beautiful very dark ruby transparent beer with no carbonation and a foamy yellowish head.
Salty citric wooden smell with some caramel and toffee and subtle sweet coffee. Apple fruitiness.
Salty stout-like taste but quite subtle. Dominated by fizziness, drop and sourwood. Wateriness dominates. Delicious.

Donkerbruin van kleur. Gisting zichtbaar. 
Ruikt naar chocolade en caramel.
Bitter biertje met een vleugje fruit.
Ook proef ik gebrande koffiebonen. 
Complex biertje. Stevige body.

Fles gedeeld met peltmeister. Mooi donker bier met met romige schuimkraag. Aroma is hoppig, karamel en cacao. Smaak is bitter met licht zurige afdronk. Mooie body en licht alcoholisch in de smaak. Goed biertje van Nederlandse bodem.
UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 Donkerbruin met een dikke crème schuimkraag. Volbitter met een zoetje, gebrande mout en ook een volle afdronk

15/IX/13 - 33cl bottle from Mitra van Bergen (Eindhoven) @ post-Zwanzeday tasting at home - BB: 13/VIII/14 (2013-870)
Clear brown to purple beer, aery irregular yellow to beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of dried fruits, sweet and sugary, raisins, some alcohol, lots of chocolate, vanilla. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty sweet, caramel, bitter hops, somewhat fruity, citrus, bit of coffee. Aftertaste: bitter hops, roasted flavours, mocha, dark chocolate, bit of vanilla.

Bottle shared by tderoeck. Dark, muddy brown with a tall, fine head. Tangy fruits in the nose, orange, cinnamon, raisin, cola, cocoa, vanilla. Malty flavor, roasty caramel, quite sweet, raisin, vanilla. Good enough but quite simple.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Mooie donkere caramel kleur met goede kraag. Ruikt niet zoveel. Standaard zoetige geur. Smaakt niet bikzonder. Beetje muf zwaar.
Pours an amber red beer with a good white head. Smells sweet, creamy yeasty. Taste licorice and too sweet. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.
Ruikt lekker, dunne schuimlaag. Wel lekker maar niet heel speciaal. Beetje zoetig naar vrij suffe smaak

yellow-brown head that disappears fast without lacing. red-brown clear colour. aroma of malt, sweet, chocolate, a bit cloying. taste is malt, caramel sweet, alcoholic with an aftertaste that is bitter, liquorice, wood/wry .. quite complex. medium body and quite a lot of carbonation. interesting brew, not quite what i expected though.  bottle 33 cl / bbf 8-2014

Bottle from MrH - thank you a lot, Johan. Before opening the bottle I had this idea in mind of how this beer should taste like (something in between Schneider Aventinus Weizen- Eisbock and Trappiste Rochefort 10), but unfortunately it was something completly else: Porter, Stout & Leather. Well, the bottle looks nice and the beer itself as well (dark brown / blackish colour with steady head and medium-smooth body). Nose is alright but not overall very impressing - malt, roast, caramel, nuts. Taste might be a little bit tough because it is very malty and spicy. Rotten leaves, caramel, campfire, woods and, well yes: Lots of malt. Leathery hints and some very light smokey finish. No beer that makes me happy, but it was solid and Im sure many other enjoy it a lot.
Thanks to Mr Hangover for that one ! Classic bock with a bit of sweets, coffee and caramel in the back. Strong one with a warm finish. Definitely enjoyable.

Bottle at the Croydonia Tasting, thanks to Jackl, 13/07/13.
Murky chestnut brown with a few floaties swimming beneath the light tan head of spotting.
Nose is oaky, dark toffee, brown sugars, gritty, light waft of booze.
Taste comprises bready malts, toffee, grain, light booze, dark fruit, berry fruits, demerara sugar.
Medium bodied with bite, moderate carbonation, bitter fruity finish.
Ok for the booze level but lacks much in the way of complexity, drinkable though.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at the Croydonia Tasting - East Croydon. Thanks to Jack for this not-too-common style - and a great pick for 30C weather! Pours deep amber with a creamy beige head. Sugary, semi-dark malts in the aroma, dark bread, dark fruits. Medium to big sweet flavor with expected dark malts, ripened dark fruits, bread, plums, etc. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Toasted dark bread to finish, light bittern toast, earth, light cocoa, more ripe fruits. Good. Decent balance for the ABV.
Really nice! Complex beer with a warm glow and delicious herbs. Recommended!

Bottle at Croydonia tasting, thanks to jackl. It pours deep brown with a small beige head. The nose is soft, sweet berry.. particularly blueberry, as well as roast, chocolate and a touch of alcohol for good measure. The taste is caramel, roasty, blueberry, blackberry, raisin, earth, chocolate, boozy warmth and faint aniseed. Medium body and fine carbonation. Smooth, boozy and rather drinkable. Quite impressive really.

Dark Brown with a red tint and a thick, tan, brown, non-lacy head. Smells of deep malt, burnt roast with chocolate, blackberries and lots of caramel with some light spices. Sort of like a English Strong Ale. Tastes of caramel and roasted malt with raisins, and a light ashy bitterness on the finish which lingers. Dry. Sweet. A nice balance between bock and porter once again with minimal hops but not overly sweet.

thanks to zenkis
Cloudy reddish brown with medium off white head.
Aroma.. quite malty, coffee that follows after my morning cigarette, kinda smoked, decent hops, fruits, spices
Sweet with moderate bitter finish. Quite dry
Interesting experience, thou this was something stout-like for me. Enjoyable brew

Nice beer with a great story behind it. Dark-red color and with a nice brown foamy head. Sweet caramel-like aroma, and a full, warm, sweet taste. The aftertaste is somewhat bitter.

Mooi bier met een goed verhaal erachter. Donkerrode kleur met een bruine kraag. Zoet caramel-achtig aroma. Eveneens een volle, warme, zoete smaak. De nasmaak is bitter.

330ml bottle. Dark brownish amber with plenty of head. Interesting aroma of plums, smoke, dates, brown sugar and cola. Smells somehow "old". The taste leans towards coffee, roast and topsoil predominantly, with some leathery fruit below. This was (as far as I can tell) a fairly young bottle and perhaps it needed some more age for the flavours to really shine.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 zwart met schuimig witte kraag, het ziet er fantastisch uit in het glas. aroma: caramout, gebrande mouten, kandij suiker, (volmoutig) smaken: drop, gebrande/cara/ en ander mouten, lichte IPA variant niet erg bijzonder. licht zoet, medium bitter, medium body, romig in de mond, redelijke co2. indruk: ik mis een beetje de zoetigheid in deze bok variant, afdronk is bitter, kruidig, nadrukkelijk aanwezig. niet erg bijzonder allemaal.
Poured a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of sweet malt. Medium body, quite smooth, flavour of sweet malt, dark fruits, bitter/sweet aftertaste.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 14.08.2010
Aroma is sweet and malty with ripe fruits, some sugar and hints of caramel. Flavour is malty with ripe fruits, caramel and toffee. Also some warming alcohol. Sweet but good!

An almost black colored beer. Aroma and flavor dominated by the bitterness coming from both the roasted malts and hopps. Bitterness is well balanced with notes of fruityness and caramel. Some alcohol warming in the back.

Stubby bottle of 330 ml, at home, poured into a snifter.
Pured carefully after letting it warm up a bit, it gave me a very dark coloured beer, with a huge three fingers beige, creamy head, with good retention. It left a light lacing behind.
Smell is molasses, chocolate, toffee and a bit of alcohol.
Taste of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Alcohol is very well hidden.
Very thick body, full and creamy. Carbonation is average I would say.
Overall a very nice sipping beer, that becomes even better as it warms up.

The head is perfect, the body darkred almost black. It smells roasty, darkmalty, creamy-alcoholic, bitter-hoppy, a bit caramel. The taste is a  bit roasty, darkmalty, sweet, full bodied and balanced, less hoppy, coffee, creamy, chocolate, Delicious! 13/13/12/13/12/13

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors dark ruby read, yeast floating around, tiny tan head. 
Aroma caramel, yeast, alcohol, malts. 
Taste coffee biter, with long caramel sweet finish, alcohol. 
Mouth-feel oily, thin. 
Wow strong Bock lots of taste, I like it!

My first eisbock thx to my secret sinterklaas!  Ruby red to brown colour with a small off white head. Smells heavy malty, some herbs, slightly alcoholic. Tastes malty, sweet, some herbs and spices i cant name. Its quite nice, but also a quite heavy beer. Full body, great carbo. A beer to enjoy slowly.

Dark red brown, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, sweet chocolate, some coffee and dark fruit. Nice taste, some warming alcohol, chocolate sweetness, hop bitterness and dark fruit. Full body, creamy carbonation.

Zo zal bokbier bedoeld zijn. Niet te zoet. Uitstekende balans. Kan vrij koud gedronken worden. Doet qua kruiden denken aan een jonge Rochefort 10, zij het iets minder geurig. Lange bittere nasmaak. Drinkt vlot weg en smaakt naar meer.

Nice beer.
Pours dark brown in glass with mocca head.
Thick mouthfeel, hints of chocolate mocca and roasted barley.
Good bokbeer

Clear dark ruby with light brown foam head, reducing to smaller foam ring, lacing to glass. Aroma is strong barley with some bread notes. Taste is bittersweet, tones of bread, barley and little yeast. Longer aftertaste, barley, liitle sweet, bread. (Velp 201211)

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel, molasses and red apples. Tasting adds coffee, chocolate and more molasses. Quite bitter aftertaste with some alcohol warmth. My first Eisbock and quite a tasty beer.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown beer with a nice, long lasting tanned head. Aroma of molasses, malts and some alcohol. Flavour is sweet from molasses and alcohol. Finishes quite dry. Really nice beer, but it could use some spicey additions. Medium to full bodied beer, long aftertaste. Very decent!
dark amber with a beautifull lasting head. toasted bread, floral hoptones, chocolate and bitter caramel produces a deep flavour and a nice dry finish with just enough sweetness.

Bottle. Pours dark amber to brown color with nice tan head. Aroma is lots of caramel, chocolate, spices, fruits, hint of licorice and coffee. Flavor is sweet, alcoholic, malty, fruity and spicy. Chocolate and coffee aftertaste. Lovely.

Hazy reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark fruit and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 300912

Bottle, 9%. Hazy dark amber/brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, dark fruits and caramel. Flavour is malt, dark fruits, oak, medium sweet, caramel, little toffee, little chocolate and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are fruits, yeast, soy, burnt caramel, alcohol, malt and notes of hops.

Dark brown coloured, almost black. Has an off-white head, mostly lasting. Malty, sweet aroma, roasted notes too. Flavor is starting heavy sweet, then alcohol, soy-sauce and a moderate bitter finish. Creamy, dry texture.
light soya and alcoholic aroma,black, light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, bitter, long finish,

33cL stubby bottle I brought back from Amsterdam, finally getting to drink this.  Poured into a HofD long stem tasting glass (a gift from John, awesome).  Date is worn out on the back label but I think its is best before 01/08/12.  It pours with a hairline lacing and a dark copper brown color.  Too dark to see through, a bit thick looking but filtered clean at the bottom of the bottle.  Aroma is filtered barleywine-like with sweet malts, alcohol, and age creeping in.  Flavor is very empty, just empty alcoholic malts. Hmmm, empty tasting is the best way I can describe this.  Undescript, sugary malts with a filtered, hollow character.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: UPDATED: SEP 3, 2012 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (2004), 33cl. Head: beige colored foam. Color: ruby brown. Aroma: malt, laurel. Taste: chocolate, laurel, bitter. Palate: dry, bitter, lasting. Overall: very nice.

Bottle courtesy of Ekstedt shared @ Ekstedts bock-tasting. Pours very dark reddish brown with a very small white head thats gone in a second without leaving any trace. Smell is sweet and syrupy with prunes, dates, wood, toasted pecans, hazelnuts, cloves and hints of bread. Taste is very sweet with dark bread, wood, prunes, golden syrup, hazelnuts and hints of wet earth and moss. Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, tiny tart and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet with bread, honey and nuts.

Bottle (33 cl) from The Cracked Kettle. CLear copper, medium off-white head. Caramelly, nutty, slightly alcoholic aroma with some herbal hops. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Semi dry, low to medium bitterness.

33 cl bottle thanks to ekstedt! Sampled on March 24, 2012Marked 9% ABVDark brown color, small tan head. Sweet, coffee, green peppers, salmiak, sausage, alcohol scent. Sweet, ash, acidic taste, also alcohol. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

Bottle shared thx to Ekstedt cons 2013-03-25
Ar: plums, rassins, port wine, coffy, chocolate
Ap: stickychocolate brown colored body, 
F: bready brown, melas, chocloate, coffey beans, caramel

sampled bottle @ Kersbierfestival 2011: A: dark brown/red  S: molasses, brown sugar & dried dark fruits  T: molasses, dark malts, brown sugar, dried dark fruits, sweet, slight roast, touch wood & chocolate  B: smooth & soft carb. - nice
Sampled at OBER Kerstbierfestival Essen 2011. Dark ruby red color, small off-white head. Smell malts, lots of wort. Taste malts, wort, sweetness. Low to medium carbonation, low to medium body.

15cl bottle sample @ Kerstbierfestival 11, Essen. Hazy dark red with small tanned head. Nose : Dried fruits (plums), caramel, chocolate with raisins. Sip : Oily with small carbonation. Sweet start with dried fruits and smokiness in the background. Bitter and little sour ending. Among many sampled beers at the festival this one is going to be forgotten.
Murky brown coloration.  No head retention.  The alcohol taste and odor is overwhelming.  Virtually no bock taste remains.
tasted like roasted malt as expected. not my kind of bok.
Strong, dark but difficult bot to fund good. Great hit of alcohol, but lots of dark sugar rather than roast malt
330 ml bottle a dark brown colored beer with a beige head aroma sweet malts dark fruits caramel spicy and hops flavor roasted malts caramel fruits spicy and bitter hops

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2013 nice thick aroma full of chocolat and roasted malts, some coffey... Taste is good too, balanced, bitter and sweet, chocolat, roasted malts and hints of coffey, it gets sweeter later on, finish is very nice, dark, bitter and somewhat fruity... its quite a lively beer yet thick and smooth.... great ijsbok

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Very murky brown body starting with a creamy head that slowly but surely disappears. Liquorish, brown sugar, loads of caramel, brandy - but alcohol relatively hidden for an eisbock. Tasty balanced body with loads of flavour to experience. Aftertaste a bit short but not alcoholic. Very nicely done brew. (33cl bottle, 2,50 EUR)

Dark hazy reddish brown, off-white head. Aroma sweet malty, reminding of kvass. Raisins, caramel, some alcohol in the nose, yeast, fruity hops. Flavour rather sweet malty, caramel, some herbs. Notes of yeast and roasted malts. Light roasted and hoppy bitterness. Finish rather sweet with lingering burned malt notes.
(From 33cL bottle)

Thanks to Alex... Light brown, very light tope head... The nose is VERY Belgian, smells like a dunkelwiesse, some raisins, sugar and alcohol, settles downs after a bit to smell like a pop... Charred bread with raisins and brown sugar, really good eisbock
(bottled)  ...brown sugar ice skating on frozen alcohoic dark malt...cloying rich malty clusters in the mouth ..The caramel notes in this is a drunken alcoholic.

Bottle shared at home.  Pours dark hazy brown with off white head.  Aroma is malt and dark fruits.  Flavor is burnt caramel, dough, malt, raisins, liquorice, chocolate.  Very soft carbonation but slight alcohol afterburn.  Great Dutch bokbier.

Malzig-süßer Antrunk, der Ähnlichkeiten mit einem Barley Wine hat. Er unterscheidet sich aber in der Herbe, die hier deutlich erkennbar ist und das würzige Malz bremst. Im Mittelteil bremsen sich Herbe und Malz gar gegenseitig aus, von den erwarteten schmeckbaren 9% ist absolut nichts auszumachen. Schade, es hätte dem Bier mehr Charackter verliehen. Zum Ende hin ist die Herbe verschwunden, das Malz agiert halbherzig. Etwas trocken, muffig. Ich habe Besseres erwartet. 12/9/9/8/10/9

3rd May 2009 Cloudy chocolate brown beer. Semi dry palate. Rich malt with a good dash of chocolate and a little aniseed alcohol and brandy. Not nad but was hoping for a lot more from this big Dutch Eisbock!
0,3 liter fles.goede bokbier. mooie bitter. wel aan te bevelen voor nog een bokje.

A - Pours a very dark mohogany brown with a rich dense head that leaves some very nice lacing.

S - chocolate, roasted malt, straw, metal and yeast

T - Quite dry and yeasy not malty like I expected. some roast malt and chocolate, and some spice and hops at the end. Not a hint of booze which is amazing for the strength.

M&D - This is smooth as silk and so easy to drink. Almost like its a session beer. I could drink a few of these as it also leave a clean dry aftertaste

A really nice beer and different from what I expected. I would not be surprised if they changed the recipe as I got none of the sweetness that is in reviews from last year and before.

Bottle at Kerstbier Festival, Essen, Belgique, 19.12.10   Pours conker brown in colour with light beige head. There is an immediate warmth from the alcohol, though not too boozy. There is a also a slightly fruity twang. Some burnt toffee, spicy, getting better as it warms up.  A6 A3 T7 P3 Ov13 3.2

Bottle.  Dark brown with a beige foam.  Aromas are weetabix and strawberry with floral notes.  Bready yeast with chocolate and light roast malts.  Creamy with some oakiness.  Flavours are sweet malts with cookie dough yeastiness.  Some cocoa powder with hints of banana milkshake.  Liquorice with light pine.  Peppery but not overbearing alcohol on the finish.  Pretty good.

On tap at Arendsnest in Amsterdam, November 2010.

Hazy brownish/red with a small creamy head. Not that balanced, quite boozy. Still rather drinkable with taste of spices and malt.

Almost black, small off white head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, cacao, coffee. Reasoanble bitter taste, fizzling in mouth, smooth, with dark chocolate and mocca. Medium to long finish, reasonable bitter with a little alcohol in it, not unpleasnt. Nice stronk bok.
I didnt think it was as special as predicted. It was good, not special. Wouldnt have it again

Bottle:
Nice light brown foamy head, disappears slowly.
Nice brown to dark brown colored beer.
Smell hops, sweets, smoke, toasted malts, mushrooms and spices.
Taste lot of chocolate, caramel, grass, hops, bitter, slight dry, toasted malts and brown sugars.
Really enjoyed this one.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2012 33cl bottle fom ABCBeers
Good white head.  Dark amber colour.  Smooth beer.  Always love SNAB beers, yummy!

(Bottle, Café Arendsnest, Amsterdam, 2 Aug 2010) Dark brown colour, hazy, with brief pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of chocolate, brown sugar and dark bread. Malty, toasty taste with chocolate, dark fruit and dark bread. Slightly vinous finish with a mild bitterness. Almost full body, fairly sweet with some alcohol shining through. Very nice one.

Pours a murky brown color with a medium offwhite head. Aroma of sweetness with fruits and malt. Flavor of fruits, malt, sweetness and alcohol warmth. The body is medium with a liquorous texture and lively carbonation.

bottle, traded with Bierkoning - Danke! Deep brown colour, mid-sized off-white head. Full-bodied, malty with a spicy touch, lots of spices and herbs present in the flavour, as well as dark dreid fruit. Delicious!
Dark "senseo coffee" brown pour with medium head. Caramel aroma with different hops. Long hops taste and aftertaste.
Pours a hazy amber color with a creamy white head. Aroma is spicy chocolate malt. Flavor is full with spice, sweet beginning and a slightly bitter finish. Well balanced. Medium carbonation.
33cl, at 9%Vol, exclusive Dutch brewfirm, from Slijterij van Bergen Eindhoven, complex Eisbock, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, good Winter brew

The Ijsbok won the title of best Dutch bockbeer at the Bokbierfestival of 2007 and 2008. They are sure to be one of the favorites this year as well (2009). The smell of the beer aint particularly impressive, but it looks beautiful with its dark amber molasses colour. It has sufficient carbonation to tickle your palate, and the taste is well-rounded and smooth with customary bockbier sweetness. Its sweetness gets balanced by spicy hop bitterness though. The alcohol taste is so hidden that one is almost disinclined to believe that it really has 9%. It tends to manifest after you have swallowed a mouthful, but not like sharp tingles creeping up your nose. The aftertatse is more like the one you get from eating a chocolate praline with liqueur filling. A very well crafted brew.

tap at Arendsnest in Amsterdam - Pours deep amber with a medium sized lingering head.  It smells of dark fruity malt.  The flavor is sweet toasted caramel malt, dark fruit, and spice with more hops than is typical for the style.  It works well though.  This brew has a nice full body and some good hops bitterness in the finish.  Very tasty.

Bottela thanks to Edo(Bierkoning). Mediuml firm head. Fruity aromas pear,plum, raisins and roasted malt. Sweetish tast of roasted malt, sugar, caramel and ripe red fruits. Very well balanced and drinkable despite the high abv. I enjoyed it a lot !
Bottle at home. A pretty solid, and high-alochol content, bock. Vary flavourful with sweet, charamel and fruits tastes. Fades well and turns spicy.

Courtesy of Philippe (Bov)Very dark chestnut color, almost black; big head. Nice aroma of malt and caramel, also some chocolate and maybe liquorice and spices. Medium bodied, less thick and sweet than other examples; mostly chocolate flavor. In the end the alcohol is warming. Because of the chocolate, it reminds me more a Strong Belgian than an Eisbock.

Bottle. Hazy, ruby-amber coloured, mid-sized, stable tanned head. Molasses, caramel and dried berries in the aroma, accompanied by a tinge of yeast. solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium to full bodied. Becomes even more bitter and drier in the malty and fruity finish. Very O.K. ........
Bottle at Plan B. - Tasting. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Dark fruits, berries, chocolate, licorice, roasted, ryebread, yeasty, high malty, sweetness, dryness. OK.
Botella. Hazy dark brown colour with a medium light brown head. Roasty malty and chocolate dark fruity soft flavour.

nice caramelly aroma,  hard roasted stuff, slight aged beer.
dark,  small lt brown head.
fl: nicely roasted, strong licorice, balanced toward the smoked/roasted end.

On tap @ ’t Arendsnest. Deep dark murky brown colour, off-white creamy head. Aroma of chocolate, malts and raisins. Flavour is the same, a little bitter finish, fullbodied, a lot softer flavours than the Ezelenbok. Alcohol very well hidden. Really nice bock.

Amsterdam 08. On tap @ t Arendsnest. Pours a clear brown with a tanned head and lacings. Sweet with caramel aromas and hints of toasted malts. Also some dark fruit aromas. Savoury. Medium to full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Hides alcohol well.

At the vonk slijterij in Zaandam, very dark brown, wow complex one, very smood with spices, very fruity smell, gentle bitter, raisin,  dough, cooked vegetables, vanilla, woody.
Very good bock with natural ingredients
Thanks for sharing Jason.  This beer I did not like.  It is like a dunkel in my opinion.  Unfortunately my notes were laundered, but I know I didn’t like this beer.

Bottled, thanks to Edo!  Poured clear deep brown with a creamy, short, well-retained cap of beige head.  The aroma picked up toasted caramel and dark fruits, showing its age in the form of mild, complementary oxidation.. touch of alcohol at the back that never got in the way.  The flavor had toffee and aged caramel at the core with prickly dark fruits and light bitterness surrounding.. mild woody sourness around and a dry caramelly finish.. tasty.  Medium-bodied on the palate and dry.. sourness and graininess got it the way a little, but it still felt solid.

Bottle... Pours a murky, caramel-color with a large, creamy, off-white head. Fantastic retention. Vinous, malty aroma offers notes of caramel, fruitcake and toffee. Full-bodied with an ultra-creamy mouthfeel and pillow-soft carbonation. Salty, boozy and vinous. Moderately bitter. Low residual sugar. Finishes way too salty for my taste... I dont quite get this one. Thanks to bierkoning for providing the bottle!

Bottle. [thank you, Skortila/Caesar]Pours deep brown with a nice, creamy yellowish cappucino head on top. Aroma has toffee, bread, some apples, coriander and other spices. Low carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Flavour is nicely balanced, good sweetness, nice viniousness. Caramel, liqourice, ginger, coriander and liqourice. Finish is lightly warming with alcohol, liqourice and spices. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2008 courtesy of oh6gdx - cloudy reddish-brown colour with a firm and persistent beige head; aroma of bread, pear and caramel; dusty; sweet and very malty, slightly sticky; some late bitterness, moderately dry, long malty and caramelish aftertaste with notes of gingerbread
bottle 330 ml. brown hazy colour. taste is trong, bock-like, yet more sweet, choclaty

Bottled, alc. 9 % (BB 08/2009)
Dark brown color, medium-sized tan head. Sweet malty and spicey aroma. Licorice, dark toasted malts, some spices, some hops, quite big malty backbone. After this aftertaste is suprisingly thin with some alcohol, dark fruits and malt. Anyhow another pretty good brew from De Proef mill.
Muddy brown colour. Malty aroma. Smell of alcohol is present too. Slight aniseed flavour at first, some softer cocoa flavours come through in the aftertaste. Rich texture, slightly oily.
330ml bottle. Dark red, almost black body with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and herbs. Flavor is slightly burnt malt, coffee, dry fruit and overripe fruit. Complex.

Bottle - Dark clear chestnut body, lasting beige head; Spicy very Earl Grey like nose, sharper then malty smooth; Smooth texture, smooth carbonation on malty smooth body with lots of sharp hop bitterness; Long very bitter finish. Eisbock, well, not you everyday Eisbock. A strange but very interesting combo of a beer with lots of character.
Dark brown colour, off white medium head. Aroma has roasted malts and spices. Flavour has chocolate malts, spices. Very drinkable!

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 Draught (Arendsnest, Amsterdam) (7:4:8:3:14=3.6)
Deep cloudy red. Sweet aroma - dark malts. Taste is a bit, erm, wow! Shocking, but very inviting. Hoppy and malty taste, a bit marmite, a bit burnt, sticky, hoppy, and rubber on the roof of my mouth. In some ways its a bit too much of a mix and slightly incoherent, but all the same its a stonking strong bock.
Rerate: 330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut! (6:4:7:3:14=3.4)
Lovely malty aroma. Even more malty taste. Light palate, drinkability good. Touch of alcohol occasionally, but with that level of malts it works well.

Thank you Edo/Bierkonig for this delightful beer! Its mahogany, slightly hazy and it has a red hue. The head is huge, nice and creamy. The aroma has loads and loads of roasted malt. The flavour has a light sweetness, loads of roasted malt, caramel, licorice, burnt dark candy sugar and a light citrussy bitterness. It has a remarkably nice body and balance, its almost porter like. Its beyond doubt the best bock I have had up till now! Yummi!!

Medium light brown head. Slightly hazy deep red body. Sweet bubblegum, licorice, and candy aroma with alcoholic roasty malt notes. Wild berry and earthy licorice taste. Dryish chocolatey licorice aftertaste is perhaps the strongest taste. Overall there is surprisingly little taste and depth, though. As you drink, the chocolate comes to dominate more and more. Mild, cool mouthfeel. Not bad, but disappointing for such a strong beer. (0.33l bottle, de Gekraakte Kettel, Amsterdam. BBD Aug 09.)

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2008 A dark brown beer with a medium beige head. The aroma of burned roasted malts, also a little sweet aroma. Chocolate and coffee taste. There are also some alcohol notes in it. A little spicy. A very good and nice bockbeer. I think one of the best.

33cl bottle: Pours dark brown with red edges. Thin but tight off-white head that doesnt last too long. Upon opening the bottle, big sweet malty aromas pour out making way for winter spices being pushed through by alcohol. A bit of coffee and black licorice also stumbles out. The licorice comes back in the flavor with sweet malts, mixed fruit, light vegetal, and melon. Yeast makes its appearance in the middle. In the finish, whole coffee beans get pummeled around by the alcohol but somehow win out in the end.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a dark brown with a medium tan head and an earthy, burned and sweet grainy aroma. The tasted is roasted malts and some mild sours notes, like black coffee at first and a light red wine coming after it. A long burned and bitter finish and almost no alcohol to taste. I like it very much, a great beer!

(33cl bottle) Hazy, ruby colour with a medium-sized, light-beige foamy head. Sweet, berry fruity, slightly yeasty malty nose with a spicy touch. Sweet flavour, full bodied with a smooth carbonation. Roasty malty, slightly caramelly taste with a distinctive fruity note of dried berries; moderately sweet and roasty, slightly fruity finish with an obvious alcoholic strength. Pretty warming in winter but it lacks a bit balance.

Bottled. Pours out in a beautiful hazy reddish amber colour with big white foam. Alcoholic peppery aroma of nuts, toasted malts and anise. Nuts, toasted malts, herbs and alcohol in the full flavour. Warming finish of almonds, herbs, fudge, licorice, grass and alcohol
A Mes rate: 33cl bottle at Kerstfest, Essen.Cloudy mid brown with a good tan head. Sweet but not too sweet malt with spice and a light bitterness. Slight soap in the finish but pretty decent overall.
dark brown coloured body with a off white head a malty roasted aroma a creamy malty taste and a strong malty bitter alcholic finich
Bottled. Deep amberty red colour, not much head. Aroma is alcohol, malts, nectar and some mild spices. Flavour is spices, fruits, some hoppyness and a mild sting of alcohol.

([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2007, Essen) Hazy dark amber with a small, partly lasting head. Aroma of licorice, roasty malt, and some alcohol. Licorice-malty, slightly sweet and somewhat burned flavor with low bitterness. Medium-bodied, slightly alcoholic palate with medium carbonation. Reasonably enjoyable despite the burnedness and alcohol.
Bottle Kerstbierfestival 2007: Poured a brown with a beige head. The aroma was spice and liquorice. The taste seemed coffee and mylasses, with a touch of liquorice. The finish was tingles of alcohol.

33 cL bottle, Kerstbierfestival 2007 in Essen/Belgium. Pours dark brown with a huge light brown/orange head. Lovely yeasty and slight spiced aroma. Flavour is slight chocolate flavoured, malty and with more of that creamy yeast flavour. Medium sweet. Lingers nicely into the finish with the Belgian yeast flavours. Lovely.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2011 Dark brown coloured beer with an off white head and some very light carbonation. Strong coffee malty roasted aroma and short smokey hinted. Full creamy palate. Finish is full malty, strong bitter burned with alcoholic touches. Nice.

Yesterday @ kerstbierfestival; from bottle, 33 cl. Dar red-brown color, with lightbrown head. Aroma roasted malts, spice. Medium to full body.
Taste roasted malts, some chocolate and a bitter finish. 
Good for us.

Deep mahogany beer; small yellowish rim. Sourish nose with a spicy lining, not unlike resin. Black cardemompeel. Spicy, but outspoken dry taste. Again cardemom, roasted and some chocolate; getting unexpected depths. Very dry, on the verge of astringent. Alcoholwarming and despite the dryness, well-bodied. Ah, Derek, this is a good one. You might be more sceptic yourself, I like it, and to hell with styleindications. Pity about the weak nose.

Heavy malty, light bread and a little bit of dark chocolate. Large creamy, light brown head. Good lacing. Mostly lasting longevity. Dark brown body. Moderate bitter taste of dark chocolate. Medium palate.
Sampled on tap at Wildeman. A really nice, smooth, knock-your-socks off kinda beer that would earn higher ratings from me if I had more access to it.

Bottle. Frothy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Brown colour. Moderate malty and hopy aroma. Slightly metallic but that fades away. Heavy bitter flavor. Strong chocolate notes. Nice long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Great stuff.
Tap Bokbierfestival, Amsterdam:Again the winner of the best bock of the Netherlands, high alcohol thats very balanced with the fruity tastes.

On draft at Arendsnest, Amsterdam. Red-brown coloured. Caramel malts and fruity notes in aroma together with some roasted malts and some alcohol. Sweet flavour with obvious complexity, great mouthfeel. Very nice brew.
Brown/red colored brew. Caramel and some fruits in the aroma. A bit yeasty. Very enjoyable flavor. Sweet and roasted malty with a good balanced bitterness. Dark chocolate and some fruits. Very nice!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2007 Bottled, thanks Papsoe!  Hazy mahogany colour, small beige head. Aroma of plums and cocoa powder. Sweet with rounded mouthfeel and surprisingly slim body. Fairly soft moutfheel, alcohol is evident. Fruity, yeasty and choclatey, tastes top fermented. Light salty finish.

Opaque deep brown body is topped by a frail off-white head. The nose feels quite yeasty, especially for an eisbock!, and even a bit estery, it might actually be an ale for the fruitiness does not appear to emerge all from the malts. It comprises a certain banana cloyingness on top of the chery oriented richness coated in sugary nutella and buttered cookies. The yeast feels fatigued, maybe even autolysed as mild sulfury notes peak through. Rather weird example, a butter fountain that is quite unclean yes includes some fun flavours.
Bottle. Red brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is fruit, apple, caramel. Flavour is fruit, apple, hop, caramel. Ok beer.

Bottled. Reddish-brown to golden color, and a beige head. Caramel, sweetness and some hops in the nose. The flavor is quite similar, but has a pronounced bitterness. Medium to full body with a sweet feeling. A bit anonymous, but definately not bad. (070216)
This bock poured very dark. Complex roasty malty aroma. Bold, large flavors and a heavy mouthfeel. An excellent eisbock.

Bottle @ Kerstbierfestival 2006 in Essen, BE. Dark brown color with large light-brown head. Aroma is malty, burnt (roasted) dark chocolate, caramel, fruit. Flavor is very sweet with a average duration. Very good and easy eisbock.
Bottle at Kerstbierfestival 2006, Essen. Caramel and molasses aroma. Sweet flavours, malty smokiness, some chocolate. Full-bodied, slightly sirupy. A wee too heavy?

[In my version brewed by "De Proefbrouwerij" in Lochristi, Belgium at 9.3% ABV] A red-brown beer with an OK brown head. The aroma is sweet with primary notes of caramel, but also some herbs. The flavor is sweet with notes of herbs, caramel, and wood.
Hazy deep reddish colour with a dense tan head. Sweet malty aroma with a dark fruit and alcohol touch. Malty, caramel sweet flavor and notes of dried fruit. Alcohol sweet finish.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2006 (Bottle 33 cl) In my version brewed by "De Proefbrouwerij" in Lochristi, Belgium at 9.3% ABV. Beautiful, dark mahogany with a warm, reddish glow and a creamy, beige head. Sweet aroma of roasted malt and dried fruits. Good, full body with plenty of roasted malt, caramel and overripe fruit. Lightly burned notes. Lovely. 030106

Bottled: Burgundy coloured. Hazy. Off-white dense head. Sweet and spiced aroma. Fruits and deep malttones. Chocolate, liqourice, sweet and some alcoholnotes in the flavour. Is sweet and spiced in the end. Quite warming and quite intriguing and very smooth and easy to drink.
Very dark color, very strong smell of bayleaf. Mouthwarming, licorice taste cloves, developing into sweetness, into bitters, a real beer to sipp en think over.

Dark brown with reddish shine, large off-white head. Slightly sour-malty nose. Sweet, almost syrupy taste, but compensated by a good clean bitterness that lingers long. Slightly bubblegummy, alcoholic palate, but not for its strength. All in all decent and enjoyable.
Brown colour with small beige head. Sweet aroma with notes of spices, liquorice/anis and alcohol. Nice intensive sweet flavour with notes of liquorice and apices. Well balanced bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2005 Dark-brown color with deep reddish shine and with a fluffy ivory colored froth. This Bok has a powerfull nose with hints of medicinale sirup, burned caramel, fennel-seeds and roasted malts. The taste is sweet, bitter, spicy and GREEN. It has an intens taste with a peated accent. Almost like Malt Whisky (Laphroaig)
Bottly. Aniseed aroma. Dark brown colour, small light brown head. Rather dry, roasted flavour. Dry, bitter, malty finish.
Tasted this beer on the Bockbeer festival in Utrecht, The Netherlands, on draft. Reasonable  stuff. Roasted malts, a sweet strong alcoholic bock (like a barley wine).

Keg. Amsterdam BBF2003. Deep ruby red, almost black, low head and low condition. Faintly malty aromas with a roast barley edge. Low malt like a dilute barley wine in the mouth and some malt hanging around aimlessly at the end.
Chocalat aroma with a hint of lactic. Brown color, off-white head, fair lace. Fruity, hint of lactic, light sweet, spices, medium body. Alcohol stays well hidden.
Dark amber coloured beer with a small head. Strong malty aroma. Malty, caramelly taste. Malty, slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 Creamy head. Very fruity aroma (pear) and licorice. Very sweet (in fact too sweet), syrupy taste Licorice, roasted malt, pear and apple flavors. Hint of sourness. (7 4 7 3 13 = 3.4)
Re-rate: bottle. Brown sugar in the aroma. Very sweet, sugary flavor. Pineapple, cane sugar, caramel. Too sugary sweet to make a real impression. 
(6 3 6 3 10 = 2.8)
Another re-rate: 2007 version: tap, Arendsnest. Sweet flavor with pineapple, but also a firm roast flavor, with coffee and even a hint of dark chocolate. The aroma is less outspoken as the flavor, somewhat dusty roasted as the beer warmens up ("washed clothes", says barman Robin).
Dark brown, colour, strange malty aroma. taste is bitter, sweet & malty, bit roasted. Palate is alcoholic.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 Rerate: PINT bokbierfestival 2004: Caramel and roasted malty taste. Nice full taste, spicy and malty. Good balance.
Original rating: Dark color. Skunky, caramelly aroma. Bitter taste, caramel malty. Bitter, bit rotten palate.
